definition: to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize

sentences.english: Without confirmed re-union, we may all find it hard to bear and wait.
sentences.chinese: 沒有確定的重聚，我們也許都會覺得很難忍受分離。

sentences.english: Real Madrid coach Fabio Capello wants a reunion with France international defender Jonathan Zebina.
sentences.chinese: 皇馬主教練卡佩羅希望有法國國腳澤比納重聚博納污。

sentences.english: They all look pale and sick, hoping one day to regain their strength.
sentences.chinese: 他們面色蒼白，希望有朝一日能重聚力量。

sentences.english: His past sufferings were soon forgotten when he rejoined his family.
sentences.chinese: 當他與家人重聚的時候，過去的苦難很快就忘卻了。

sentences.english: I'd see them every few weeks, enjoying the intimacy 4 of reunion.
sentences.chinese: 我每隔幾周就會和他們見面，享受親密的重聚。

sentences.english: Since 2008, separated families and friends could finally be reunited.
sentences.chinese: 從2008年開始，分開的家庭和朋友最終可以重聚。

sentences.english: This special reunion is their first time together in almost fifteen years.
sentences.chinese: 這次特殊的聚會是她們十五年來第一次重聚。

sentences.english: The Red Cross was success full in reuniting the prisoner with his family.
sentences.chinese: 紅十字會成功地使那位戰俘與他家人重聚了。

definition: to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
to combine/combination/composite character (i.e. a synonym of 合體字|合体字[he2 ti3 zi4])/(of clothes) to be a good fit
to meet together/to assemble (of a group of people)
to see each other/to meet in person
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
to meet again after a long period of separation
separated in time (usu. followed by a quantity of time)
